visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts Venn diagram illustrating the relationship between Euler and Venn diagrams. The chart should have a title 'Relationship between Euler and Venn diagrams', with axes and labels styled with specific colors and font sizes. The data series should include two main sets: 'Euler diagrams' and 'Venn diagrams', with an intersection showing the overlap. Custom colors should be used for the sets, and additional configurations should include chart margins, background, and legend settings.

data.name: Euler diagrams
data.longDescription: An Euler diagram is a diagrammatic means of representing sets and their relationships. Unlike Venn diagrams, which show all possible relations between different sets, the Euler diagram shows only relevant relationships.

data.name: Venn diagrams
data.longDescription: In Venn diagrams the curves are overlapped in every possible way, showing all possible relations between the sets. They are thus a special case of Euler diagrams, which do not necessarily show all relations.

title.text: Relationship between Euler and Venn diagrams

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration object is designed to render a Venn diagram that illustrates the relationship between Euler and Venn diagrams. The chart includes a title styled with a specific color and font size, and the axes labels are also styled with custom colors and font sizes. The data series consists of two main sets: 'Euler diagrams' and 'Venn diagrams', with an intersection representing the overlap. Custom colors are applied to the sets, and additional configurations include settings for the chart's background color, margins, and legend positioning. The tooltip provides detailed descriptions of each set, enhancing the chart's accessibility and informative value.
